Question: Java String: split String: :I have this String: String string="NNP,PERSON,true,?,IN,O,false,pobj,NNP,ORGANIZATION,true,?,p";How can I do to split it into an array every 4 commas?I would like something like this:      String[] a=string.split("d{4}");     a[0]="NNP,PERSON,true,?";     a[1]="IN,O,false,pobj";     a[2]="NNP,ORGANIZATION,true,?";     a[3]="p";
Please using this api: StringTokenizer.nextToken.
Answer:

<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>:
String string="NNP,PERSON,true,?,IN,O,false,pobj,NNP,ORGANIZATION,true,?,p";
StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(string, ",");
String[] a = new String[4];
int i = 0;
while (st.hasMoreTokens()) {
    a[i] = st.nextToken();
    i++;
}
<<<explanation>>>:
The StringTokenizer class is used to break a string into tokens. A token is a part of a string that matches the delimiters. The StringTokenizer class has two constructors:
StringTokenizer(String str)
StringTokenizer(String str, String delim)
The first constructor takes a string as an argument. The string to be tokenized is specified in this constructor. The tokens in this string are assumed to be delimited by whitespace characters.
The second constructor takes two arguments: a string containing the delimiters and a string containing the string to be tokenized.
The StringTokenizer class has three methods:
boolean hasMoreTokens()
Returns true if there are more tokens in this string tokenizer.
String nextToken()
Returns the next token from this string tokenizer.
String nextToken(String delim)
Returns the next token from this string tokenizer.
The nextToken() method returns the next token from this string tokenizer. If the string argument delim is non-null, then the next token is defined to be the substring of the string argument following the last occurrence of the string argument delim.
The nextToken(String delim) method returns the next token from this string tokenizer. If the string argument delim is non-null, then the next token is defined to be the substring of the string argument following the last occurrence of the string argument delim.
The hasMoreTokens() method returns true if there are more tokens in this string tokenizer.
